com.ibm.cloud.sdk.core.security

Class TokenRequestBasedAuthenticator<T extends AbstractToken,R extends TokenServerResponse>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.cloud.sdk.core.security.AuthenticatorBase
      • com.ibm.cloud.sdk.core.security.TokenRequestBasedAuthenticator<T,R>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Authenticator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CloudPakForDataAuthenticator, IamAuthenticator

    public abstract class TokenRequestBasedAuthenticator<T extends AbstractToken,R extends TokenServerResponse>
extends AuthenticatorBase
implements Authenticator
    This class serves as a common base class for Authenticator implementations that interact with a Token Server via a REST interface. This base class allows for the configuration of the following properties:
    • username/password - if specified, these values will be used to build a basic auth Authorization header to be sent with requests to the Token Server.
    • disableSSLVerification - a flag that indicates whether or not SSL hostname verification should be disabled.
    • headers - a Map of keys/values that will be set as headers on requests sent to the Token Server.
    • proxy - a java.net.Proxy instance that will be set on the Client object used to interact with the Token Server.
    • proxyAuthenticator - an okhttp3.Authenticator instance to be set on the Client object used to interact wth the Token Server.

      • requestToken

        public abstract T requestToken()
        Builds and invokes the REST request to fetch a new token from the Token Server. Each concrete subclass must implement this method.
        Returns:
        the token object

      • getToken

        public String getToken()
        This function returns the access token fetched from the Token Server. If no token currently exists or the current token has expired, a new token is fetched from the Token Server.
        Returns:
        the access token

      • invokeRequest

        protected R invokeRequest(RequestBuilder requestBuilder,
                          Class<? extends R> responseClass)
                   throws Throwable
        Invokes the specified request and returns the response object.
        Parameters:
        requestBuilder - the partially-built request for fetching a token from the token server
        responseClass - a Class object which represents the token server response structure
        Returns:
        an instance of the response class R
        Throws:
        Throwable - an error occurred when invoking a token request
